      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">

        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<span class="line"><!---->In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br><br><br>In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<span class="line"><!---->In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<!----></span><br>( see <span class="line"><!---->( see <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<!----></a><br>and <span class="line"><!---->and <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<!----></a><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<span class="line"><!---->This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<!----></span><br>Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<span class="line"><!---->Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<!----></span><br><br>The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()->pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<span class="line"><!---->The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()-&gt;pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master<!----></span><br>[ looks like the bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->[ looks like the bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>so v8 >= 8.3.42 ]<span class="line"><!---->so v8 &gt;= 8.3.42 ]<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 32767; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 32767; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 2335; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 2335; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<span class="line"><!---->    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<!----></span><br>    arr.concat(Number, arr)<span class="line"><!---->    arr.concat(Number, arr)<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>eval(``);<span class="line"><!---->eval(``);<!----></span><br><br>(also attached)<span class="line"><!---->(also attached)<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: v8<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: v8<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br><br>For a debug build:<span class="line"><!---->For a debug build:<!----></span><br><br>$ v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8 poc_minimized.js<span class="line"><!---->$ v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8 poc_minimized.js<!----></span><br><br><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 0x7ffee9a61060<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object: 0x7ffee9a61060<!----></span><br>==== C stack trace ===============================<span class="line"><!---->==== C stack trace ===============================<!----></span><br><br>    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(v8::base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()+0x22) [0x556ec3dfe8f2]<span class="line"><!---->    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(v8::base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()+0x22) [0x556ec3dfe8f2]<!----></span><br>    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xbd9ed7) [0x556ec3df9ed7]<span class="line"><!---->    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xbd9ed7) [0x556ec3df9ed7]<!----></span><br> [0x556ec3dec57e]<!----></span><br>    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xbcbd55) [0x556ec3debd55]<span class="line"><!---->    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xbcbd55) [0x556ec3debd55]<!----></span><br>    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xfb4a6b) [0x556ec41d4a6b]<span class="line"><!---->    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(+0xfb4a6b) [0x556ec41d4a6b]<!----></span><br>    v8/v8/src/out/debug/d8(v8::internal::Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeMarkedCodeForContext(v8::internal::NativeContext)+0xb7e) [0x556ec41d3d0e]<span class="line"><!---->         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161357#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 1:23 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161357#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 1:23 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <span class="line"><!---->With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <!----></span>a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> ) more like exposed.<span class="line"><!----> ) more like exposed.<!----></span><br>It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<span class="line"><!---->It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<!----></span><br>The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<span class="line"><!---->The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<!----></span><br><br>Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 45<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161357#c45">Comment 45<!----></a>

        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<span class="line"><!---->In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br><br><br>In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<span class="line"><!---->In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<!----></span><br>( see <span class="line"><!---->( see <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<!----></a><br>and <span class="line"><!---->and <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<!----></a><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<span class="line"><!---->This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<!----></span><br>Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<span class="line"><!---->Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<!----></span><br><br>The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()->pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<span class="line"><!---->The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()-&gt;pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master<!----></span><br>[ looks like the bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->[ looks like the bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>so v8 >= 8.3.42 ]<span class="line"><!---->so v8 &gt;= 8.3.42 ]<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 32767; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 32767; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 2335; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 2335; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<span class="line"><!---->    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<!----></span><br>    arr.concat(Number, arr)<span class="line"><!---->    arr.concat(Number, arr)<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>eval(``);<span class="line"><!---->eval(``);<!----></span><br><br>(also attached)<span class="line"><!---->(also attached)<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: v8<span class="line"><!---->Type         Thanks for the report and analysis. CC'ing some v8 folks you will hopefully take a look.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report and analysis. CC'ing some v8 folks you will hopefully take a look.<!----></span><br><br>I will attempt to repro tomorrow.         With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <span class="line"><!---->With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <!----></span>a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> ) more like exposed.<span class="line"><!----> ) more like exposed.<!----></span><br>It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<span class="line"><!---->It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<!----></span><br>The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<span class="line"><!---->The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<!----></span><br><br>Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<span class="line"><!---->In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br><br><br>In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<span class="line"><!---->In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<!----></span><br>( see <span class="line"><!---->( see <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<!----></a><br>and <span class="line"><!---->and <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<!----></a><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<span class="line"><!---->This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<!----></span><br>Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<span class="line"><!---->Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<!----></span><br><br>The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()->pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<span class="line"><!---->The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()-&gt;pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master<!----></span><br>[ looks like the bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->[ looks like the bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>so v8 >= 8.3.42 ]<span class="line"><!---->so v8 &gt;= 8.3.42 ]<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 32767; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 32767; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 2335; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 2335; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<span class="line"><!---->    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<!----></span><br>    arr.concat(Number, arr)<span class="line"><!---->    arr.concat(Number, arr)<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>eval(``);<span class="line"><!---->eval(``);<!----></span><br><br>(also attached)<span class="line"><!---->(also attached)<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: v8<span class="line"><!---->Type implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span source checkout. To prepare one, run:<span class="line"><!---->The reproduce tool requires a ClusterFuzz source checkout. To prepare one, run:<!----></span><br><br>git clone <span class="line"><!---->git clone <!----></span>https://github.com/google/clusterfuzz<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/google/clusterfuzz"><!---->https://github.com/google/clusterfuzz<!----></a> && cd clusterfuzz && git checkout tags/reproduce-tool-stable<span class="line"><!----> &amp;&amp; cd clusterfuzz &amp;&amp; git checkout tags/reproduce-tool-stable<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce this issue, run:<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce this issue, run:<!----></span><br><br>./reproduce.sh -t <span class="line"><!---->./reproduce.sh -t <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5682349085097984<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5682349085097984"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5682349085097984<!----></a> -b /path/to/build<span class="line"><!----> -b /path/to/build<!----></span><br><br>Please use the GN arguments provided in this report when building the binary. If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at <!----></span>https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5"><!---->https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<!----></a> so we can improve.<span class="line"><!----> so we can improve.<!----></span><br><br><br>************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE *************************<span class="line"><!---->************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE *************************<!----></span><br>Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.<span class="line"><!---->Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase.         With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <span class="line"><!---->With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <!----></span>a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> ) more like exposed.<span class="line"><!----> ) more like exposed.<!----></span><br>It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<span class="line"><!---->It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<!----></span><br>The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<span class="line"><!---->The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<!----></span><br><br>Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

        Description #1 by tyler...@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<span class="line"><!---->In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br><br><br>In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<span class="line"><!---->In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<!----></span><br>( see <span class="line"><!---->( see <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<!----></a><br>and <span class="line"><!---->and <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<!----></a><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<span class="line"><!---->This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<!----></span><br>Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<span class="line"><!---->Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<!----></span><br><br>The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()->pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<span class="line"><!---->The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()-&gt;pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master<!----></span><br>[ looks like the bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->[ looks like the bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>so v8 >= 8.3.42 ]<span class="line"><!---->so v8 &gt;= 8.3.42 ]<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 32767; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 32767; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 2335; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 2335; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<span class="line"><!---->    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<!----></span><br>    arr.concat(Number, arr)<span class="line"><!---->    arr.concat(Number, arr)<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>eval(``);<span class="line"><!---->eval(``);<!----></span><br><br>(also attached)<span class="line"><!---->(also attached)<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: v8<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: v8<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br><br>For a debug build:<span class="line"><!---->For a debug build:<!----></span><br><br>$ and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<span class="line"><!---->It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<span class="line"><!---->In v8, it is possible to enter a state where there is an inconsistency with code being marked for deoptimization. For a debug build, this results in a DCHECK failure like<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../../src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc, line 278<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: code == topmost_ implies safe_to_deopt_.<!----></span><br><br><br>In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<span class="line"><!---->In a normal release build (without DCHECK), the bug is much worse: the calculation performed in the surrounding code in deoptimizer calculates a new pc value to use to jump to the deoptimized code. An offset value (trampoline_pc) is fetched, but in this erroneous state, the offset is still the default value of -1.<!----></span><br>( see <span class="line"><!---->( see <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/deoptimizer/deoptimizer.cc;l=268<!----></a><br>and <span class="line"><!---->and <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:v8/src/codegen/safepoint-table.h;l=24<!----></a><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<span class="line"><!---->This results in setting pc to one byte before the start of the jitted code.<!----></span><br>Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<span class="line"><!---->Depending on the exact instructions used, and the data in the region immediately before the jitted code, this can lead to code execution, with no need to worry about ASLR (as v8 adjusts the pc relative to the existing code buffer), or any fancy pointer signing stuff.<!----></span><br><br>The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()->pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<span class="line"><!---->The simplest patch would maybe be a check that safepoint.has_deoptimization_index() or that trampoline_pc is non-negative, or another similar check like maybe code.CanDeoptAt(it.frame()-&gt;pc()) to guard the deoptimization path.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master<!----></span><br>[ looks like the bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->[ looks like the bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>so v8 >= 8.3.42 ]<span class="line"><!---->so v8 &gt;= 8.3.42 ]<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 32767; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 32767; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let j = 0; j < 2335; j++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let j = 0; j &lt; 2335; j++) {<!----></span><br>        Number;<span class="line"><!---->        Number;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    var arr = [, ...(new Int16Array(0xffff)), 4294967296];<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>eval(``);<span class="line"><!---->eval(``);<!----></span><br><br>(also attached)<span class="line"><!---->(also attached)<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES,         Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5682349085097984<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <span class="line"><!---->With the caveat that I am not a v8 expert: I also don't think the bad behavior was necessarily caused by the revision I listed ( <!----></span>a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4"><!---->a447a44f31fc153590598698d33d6efd73334be4<!----></a> ) more like exposed.<span class="line"><!----> ) more like exposed.<!----></span><br>It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<span class="line"><!---->It seemed like something was wrong with having more opportunities for optimizing due to JumpLoop: I'm not sure exactly, but something like triggering optimization twice in the same top level loop? and perhaps that patch allowed that to happen more easily.<!----></span><br>The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<span class="line"><!---->The iteration counts for the two inner loops (the ones over j) are what is required to trigger optimization twice in the same iteration (or so it seems with some console.log debugging and running v8 with --trace-osr).<!----></span><br><br>Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if that's helpful, just trying to add in some info that I glossed over in the initial report in case it helps better identify the root cause.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * is disabled for this component.

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {

 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
